page.title: 17WORKING FOR A LIVING
page.content: Occupations in Westonzoyland today are very different from about a hundred years ago.Then peoples occupations were connected with farming mostly and they lived and worked in the village.Today our village is very much {a dormitory village}with most people living here and working elsewhere. . { The biggest employer is our school.} We employ some 20 people to service the needs of the school.Localfarms use mostly family labour.The Somerset Youth Association Headquarters caters for visiting youth and handicapped visitors.The shops and pubs employ local staff.Most of the working population travel into Bridgwater for work at British Cellophane or to Hinkley Point Nuclear Power Station.Many work in commerce in Bridgwater.Some go to R.O.F.Puriton.
